Our daily lives would be completely different. We would no longer need to spend time and resources on activities such as swimming, diving, and other water-related activities. We would be able to explore the depths of the ocean and see the beauty of the underwater world.

Society would be transformed. People would be able to travel to different parts of the world and explore the oceans without the need for expensive equipment or travel. This would open up new opportunities for research, exploration, and tourism.

Science would advance rapidly. We would be able to study the ocean and its inhabitants in ways that were previously impossible. This would lead to new discoveries and advancements in fields such as marine biology, oceanography, and engineering.

Our understanding of the world would be expanded. We would be able to see and experience things that were previously hidden from us. This would lead to a greater appreciation for the natural world and a better understanding of our place in it.

We would be able to live in underwater communities. With the ability to breathe underwater, we would be able to build and live in communities that are entirely submerged in the ocean. This would lead to new forms of architecture, engineering, and urban planning.
